Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading video and there is no evidence provided to substantiate the claim of people being poisoned after drinking soft drinks.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video is not related to people being poisoned after drinking soft drinks, but rather it is about a domestic violence incident in India.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by falsely linking the video to poisoning from soft drinks when there is no evidence to support this.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video is evidence of people being poisoned after drinking soft drinks without any factual basis.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the video is about a domestic violence incident, as reported by local media and news channels.
Understate: None of the biases indicate an understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: None of the biases indicate that the claim falters at times.
